meanings.definition: Resembling a stick in shape or appearance.
meanings.sent1: The sticklike figure of the scarecrow stood tall in the field.
meanings.sent2: The branches of the tree were long and sticklike, reaching towards the sky.
meanings.sent3: The sticklike shadow of the streetlight made it look like a giant pencil.
meanings.sent4: Her sticklike fingers delicately picked up the tiny seashell.
meanings.sent5: The sticklike legs of the insect made it blend in perfectly with the twigs.

meanings.definition: Having a thin, elongated form similar to a stick.
meanings.sent1: The sticklike branches of the bush swayed gently in the breeze.
meanings.sent2: The sticklike structure of the model tower was impressive in its detail.
meanings.sent3: The sticklike appearance of the alien's antenna made it seem comical.
meanings.sent4: Her sticklike arms reached out to grab the book from the shelf.
meanings.sent5: The sticklike shape of the icicle hung from the roof, sparkling in the sunlight.
